newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps mostly steady, fuel in backwardation.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps mostly steady, fuel in backwardation.

text.p: European oil swaps were mostly steady on Wednesday morning showing little real movement from Tuesday's levels.
Brent CFDs lost a couple of cents or so on the balance of this week, but firmed a touch further out. Naphtha gained a touch, while gasoline and fuel were unchanged.

Brent CFDs saw June 11-13 move out to -95 cents under August Brent from -93 cents while June 16-20 pulled back to -73 cents under August compared with -77 cents under on Tuesday. June 23-27 was a couple of cents stronger at -64 cents and June 30-July 4 was also firmer by three cents or so at -54 cents against August.
Heavy fuel held steady with June at $85.50 and July still backwardated by 50 cents or so. Nothing was heard done on the swaps, but $86 and $86.25 were wet deals.
Gasoline was unchanged around $188.50 for June while July was pegged around $183. Naphtha was very slow with June at $179-180.50 with July at $178-179, about $1 weaker.
Gas oil crack spreads were steady with 4Q97 at $4.53, 1Q98 at $4.55 and 2Q98 marginally stronger at $4.05.
